isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - INJECTION PUMP, NOZZLES, FUEL FILTER, SUPPLY PUMP AND GLOW PLUGS - Removing Injection Pump (all applications) - REMOVING INJECTION PUMP GEAR

step1.para:
Remove the injection pump adapter housing bolts and adapter housing ( Figure 9.37
).

important.para: DO NOT REMOVE INJECTION PUMP DRIVE GEAR YET.

step1.para: Bar the engine over to TDC compression stroke for No. 1 cylinder.

note.para: Remove glow plugs to facilitate turning engine over by hand.

step1.para: To verify that No.1 piston is at TDC position, remove the right valve cover and observe the No. 1 cylinder valve lever. The injection pump drive gear dowel must be at four o'clock position. The scribe line on the vibration damper should be at TDC.

note.para: With engines at TDC compression for No. 1 cylinder, gears should have the stamped "Y"'s aligned. Refer to Figure 9.38.

step1.para: Slide the injection pump gear back (do not remove) to expose the top of the camshaft gear when looking down into the top of the front cover. Draw a reference line up from the "Y" mark on the injection pump gear prior to removing the gear. DO NOT REMOVE THE INJECTION PUMP GEAR WITHOUT FOLLOWING THIS PROCEDURE.

Remove the injection pump drive gear, Figure 9.39
.
